html:
Answer: Yes he did.​ I was there.​ Spit on my shoes too.​ It was meant as a sign.​.​.​
Duy's Digest
Top Stories For You
Is it true that Elon Musk was spat on by one of the Russian chief rocket designers?
Jim Cantrell, On SpaceX founding team with Elon Musk
Written Sep 29, 2016

Yes he did. I was there. Spit on my shoes too. It was meant as a sign of disrespect. We were trying to buy a rocket that was his baby and he thought that we were not seriou...

Can a typical Google employee easily solve medium questions on LeetCode, or is it more likely he is 'out of practice' of basic algorithms & data structures for programming?
Lalit Kundu, Software Engineer at Google
Written Oct 11

From the perspective of this question, I would classify software engineers broadly into three categories:

  • engineers who are involved in hiring process: interviews, hiring co...

Hannah Yang upvoted this answer.

Written Sep 24

“Breaking the internet” is generous, but I’ll take a stab at this.

When a gal gets ready for a special occasion, the “before and after” pictures can be…um, shocking.

In our “...

What is it like to be a millionare?
James Michaels, Self Employed at Self-Employment (1996-present)
Updated Jun 5

I reached this at the age of 30.

Honestly, things didn’t change much as a whole.

  1. I still live in the same city, although a different house now. Not a mansion, but I went from...

What are Jupyter Notebooks not good for in Data Science?
Yassine Alouini, I have written data science pipelines using Python libraries
Written Oct 11

To start, I would like to share Joel Grus’s latest presentation[1]. In it, you will find a lot of illustrated drawbacks of notebooks and some positive points.

There are a lo...

What is the most awesome way you've seen someone resign from their job?
Kathi Gardner, Writer
Written Oct 6

A coworker who had really not been treated well by our supervisor quietly applied for a job 2 steps above that supervisor. He was very well qualified, and used contacts out...

How did Einstein learn calculus?
Gali Weinstein, Historian of modern physics
Written Oct 7

Between the age of 12 and 16, Einstein had already taught himself calculus. In 1949 Einstein wrote in his Autobiographical Notes:

"At the age of twelve through sixteen, I fa...

 Read More »
Why are some programmers unemployed?
John L. Miller, 25 years at Microsoft, Amazon, Google, etc. C++, C, Java, Basic, etc. PhD.
Updated Sep 28, 2017

Programmers can be unemployed for a wide variety of reasons.

  1. They’re not very good and can’t pass an interview.

or, they’re good but…

  1. They can’t pass an interview because thei...

Jason Diprose, Founder/CEO, Energy One (2017-present)
Written Mon

How counter-productive the stereotypical entrepreneur lifestyle can be. According to stereotypes, an entrepreneur works endless hours to achieve their goals, keeping sleep ...

I will spend every penny of Apple's $40 billion in the bank, to right this wrong. I'm going to destroy Android because it's a stolen product. I’m willing to go thermonuclea...

Hi there, are you getting on OK with the site?

This message is just to let you know there is a real, live human here (well, a developer actually; not sure if that counts).

So if you ever have any questions or suggestions, please, please don't hesitate to get in touch. We crave feedback like mesozoic mammals crave an asteroid :-)

We're also always keen to know more about what people are doing on the site, so if you fancy sharing a bit about what you're doing, how you found us and why you chose to use us, it really helps us to focus our efforts for the future...

Hope to hear from you!

Giles + the PythonAnywhere team.

Giles Thomas
Developer

PS we hope you don't mind hearing from us, but if you want to you can click here to unsubscribe from messages like this.

Hello!


How are you? I hope you are doing well. As you know, during the last days I sent you a free mini-course: The 5 Pillars For Learning Spanish.

 

In those videos I explain powerful techniques for learning Spanish. I would like you to see in practice how they work. I want to give you a FREE gift:


http://www.unlimitedspanish.com/free-demo/


Here you will find free lessons of two courses:

  1. Total Beginner's 30 Day Crash Course. 
  2. Unlimited Spanish Original Course. 


You do not have to pay anything, you do not have to sign up. Just follow the link and click on the download links and start enjoying them :-)


http://www.unlimitedspanish.com/free-demo/


This is my gift to you. I hope you enjoy it!


I would love to know your opinion about these lessons! Feel free to reply this e-mail if you want to talk with me about it.


Have a great day,


~Òscar, founder and director.


Unlimited Spanish

PS: You can get all the lessons at:

http://www.unlimitedspanish.com/online-spanish-course/



IMPORTANT - To make sure you ALWAYS RECEIVE MY EMAILS - please add my e-mail address to your address book or approve me as a sender. If no images show up in this e-mail, you may also have to approve images for my e-mail address.

Albinyana, Sant Fost de C., Barcelona 08105

html:
Make your designs bounce, drop, swipe and more!
Weekly Newsletter
 Learn & be inspired
If you’re trying to get traction on social media—for your business, or maybe just your pet pug’s Instagram account—you’ll know what a crowded marketplace it is. Every minute of the day, hundreds of brands are posting content that practically screams “look at me!”

You already know the value of adding images to your posts—that’s probably what brought you to Canva in the first place. But if you want to get next-level engagement, you should get your designs moving with animation.

Here are three reasons you should make your next social media post an animation.

1. They draw the eye
With animation, your designs take on a whole new dimension. Movement grabs a viewer’s attention in a way a static image simply can’t. And in a busy social media feed, that’s a crucial point of difference.

2. They’re favored by social media algorithms
Ahh, the mysterious ways of “the algorithms”. Figuring out how to make the social media algorithms work for, rather than against you, can be headache inducing. Hot tip: posts containing videos and GIFS get higher levels of engagement (those likes and shares that you crave) and are more likely to be featured in your audience’s feed.

3. They’re surprisingly easy to make
They might look fancy, but that doesn’t mean they take hours—or hundreds of dollars—to create. With Canva’s Animator tool, you can bring your Canva designs to life with one simple click. Canva for Work subscribers will find it in the Publish menu. You can download your animation as a GIF or a movie. Not a Canva for Work subscriber? Then try your free, 30-day trial.

Magically animate my design

Trending now: Canva’s freshest templates
Facebook Post
Instagram Post
Poster
Get more design tips on our blog
20 ad campaigns all nonprofits should see

Learn how to create innovative campaigns that transform traditional advertising formats.
Rule social media in only a few minutes a day

We share five tips that will help you streamline your social media marketing.
Design an eye-catching digital portfolio

Read on for tips and tricks to creating an eye-catching digital portfolio so that you’re prepared for any new opportunity that comes your way.
About us | Terms of use | Privacy Policy | Unsubscribe |
2 Lacey Street, Surry Hills, NSW, 2010, Australia
Stay connected
Subject: How to stand out on social media – for all the right reasons.

html:
Message type: [WNC-376106]
Search Console

Improve the search presence of https://atschool.live/

To: Webmaster of https://atschool.live/

Google systems show that you recently verified your site in Search Console (or created a site with Blogger or Google Sites which does this automatically). We have some tips to help you get the most of this free service and maximize your site performance on Google Search.

Set up your Search Console account now:

1

Add all your website versions

Make sure you add separate Search Console properties for all URL variations that your site supports, including https, http, www, and non-www.

Add a site
2

Share access with co-workers

If you want other people to access your error reports and search analytics in Search Console, add them with the appropriate access levels.

Manage site users
3

Submit a sitemap file

This helps Google better understand how to crawl your site.

Submit a sitemap
4

Learn how to work with Search Console

If you read only one document, this is it.
Using Search Console

Not sure how to set this up? Use our help resources.

• Learn more details about site verification and how to set permissions for other users.
• Get help in setting a preferred domain or setting a geographic target.
• Learn what a sitemap is and how to manage it.
• Ask questions in our forum for more help - mention message type [WNC-376106].
Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway Mountain View, CA 94043 | You've received this service announcement email because your site is listed in Google Search Console | Unsubscribe from this type of message
Add partners who should receive messages for this Search Console account
Subject: Improve the search presence of https://atschool.live/

html:
View in Browser

  

OCTOBER 2018 newsletter

Buildpacks Go Cloud Native

Cloud Native Buildpacks is an API standard for turning source code into Docker images. CNBs embrace modern container standards while retaining the simplicity that have made buildpacks so popular.

Heroku Buildpack Registry: Making Buildpacks Open and Shareable

Buildpacks let you build Heroku apps using technologies like Meteor, Elixir, and React. With the Heroku Buildpack Registry, you can easily contribute and share buildpacks with the community.

12-Factor CLI Apps

At Heroku, we’ve come up with a methodology called the 12-factor app for web applications. In that spirit, here are 12 CLI factors to keep in mind when building your next CLI application..

[Technical Session] Step-by-Step: Getting to a Multi-Region, Microservices-Based App

In this Dreamforce session, Jon Byrum, Senior Director Heroku Product, demos how you can refactor your monolithic app, host it in multiple regions, and privately access data in AWS, Google Cloud, and Salesforce.

Dreamforce Developer Keynote - Builds Apps of the Future

GM of Heroku Margaret Francis and Salesforce’s developer evangelists shared key insights and use cases for Salesforce developers - including updates and live demos of new Heroku features.

[Technical Session] Painting with Light and Go​

Hunter Loftis, Heroku Engineering Manager, shows you how to build a scalable and parallel path tracer to render a 3D image using Golang on Heroku.

  

Heroku Button
of the Month

The Hasura GraphQL Engine might be the fastest way to start using GraphQL. Deploy Hasura’s GraphQL Engine (to a free Heroku dyno), define your PostgreSQL schema, and instantly you’ll have a working GraphQL API.

Heroku Add-on
of the Month

Cloudcube provides easy Amazon S3 file uploads and privacy management with an intuitive dashboard.

Upcoming Events

Devoxx Belgium 

November 13-15 – Antwerp, Belgium
Devoxx is a global conference focused on Java, web, mobile and JVM languages, and is run by top developer talent, community groups and expert event specialists. Join Heroku and 1,200 other Java enthusiasts in Belgium at this year’s event. Visit our booth to speak with our JVM experts, see demos and pick up some swag to take home. Don’t miss our very own Joe Kutner’s presentation “10 Mistakes Hackers Want You to Make” on Thursday at 9:30am.

RubyConf

November 13-15 – Los Angeles, CA
Heroku is returning to RubyConf 2018, the main annual gathering of Rubyists from around the world since 2001. Yukihiro Matsumoto (Matz) will be delivering the opening keynote at this year's RubyConf, joined by a talented list of both proven stars and folks who are sure to be your new favorites.

Dev Center

New Dev Center Articles

Integrating Heroku and the Salesforce Platform

You can integrate Heroku and the Salesforce Platform in several ways. This article describes the most common use cases for each type of integration.
 

Salesforce, The Landmark @ 1 Market St. Suite 300
San Francisco, CA 94105
Update your email preferences
Privacy
Subject: Advancing Standards & Productivity: Buildpacks for Docker Images; Microservices; and 12-factor CLIs

html:
Hi there,

Some new content for you this week! We’re launching 2 new Projects. In the first, you will explore FiveThirtyEight's Halloween Candy dataset using logistic regression. And in the second, you will write functions to analyze Rwanda’s potato prices.

We’re also launching 6 new courses. Including an intro course to Python for Finance, a course on building recommendation engines, a course on the end-to-end process for creating an R package, and much more! Check them out below.

Projects:
• Explore 538's Halloween Candy Rankings (R Project)
• Functions for Food Price Forecasts (R Project)

Courses:
• Intro to Python for Finance
• Visualization Best Practices in R
• Interactive Data Visualization with rbokeh (R Course)
• Building Recommendation Engines in PySpark (Python Course)
• Developing R Packages
• Mixture Models in R

Happy learning!

The DataCamp Team
DataCamp Inc. | 350 Fifth Avenue | Suite 7730 | New York, NY 10118 | Unsubscribe
Subject: 👻 New Halloween Project, Finance Course & More!

html:
Learn to be the highly-valued security-minded developer who spots problems before they happen.




Duy anh, advance your career by learning cloud security skills

In today’s world, developers and engineers with proven security mindsets and hands-on security experience enjoy significant career advantages.

In this program, you’ll learn the most valuable cybersecurity skills, work with the most relevant tools, and absorb the most important concepts. Your projects will include:

Detecting cloud misconfigurations to prevent security holes

Designing and deploying a security event aggregation system

Attacking and defending a cloud production environment

We built this program with Chronicle, Alphabet’s X cybersecurity moonshot, because there is no substitute for learning from the best.

Enroll today, and add the cybersecurity skills that will take your career to a whole new level.
VIEW SYLLABUS

Discover how to have an informed security mindset

Build and manage secure applications with real-world cybersecurity projects designed by industry leaders.

BUILT IN COLLABORATION WITH

Class begins Oct‍ober 30‍th

Enroll to start building and managing secure applications.
ENROLL NOW

Help  | Security 
 
 

Please do not reply to this email. To get in touch, go to the PayPal website and click Help & Contact.

How do I know this is not a fake email?

Emails from PayPal will always address you by your first and last name. Fake or "phishing" emails tend to have generic greetings such as "Dear PayPal member".

If you're unsure, forward the suspicious email to phishing@paypal.com.au and we'll let you know if it's really coming from us.

Find out more about fake and phishing email

  1. We will provide you with a PythonAnywhere account, which allows you to run your code on our servers, including creating one or more public websites.
  2. This will cost you $5.00 per month unless you switch to a different kind of account on our "Accounts" page.
  3. This is to remind you that, if you are an EEA consumer, you may have the right to cancel the contract (that is, to delete your account) within 14 days of concluding the contract. (This right does not apply in certain circumstances, e.g. contracts which are completed.) You must send us clear statement saying that you wish to cancel via email to support@pythonanywhere.com. We will refund all payments within 14 days thereafter but, if you agreed to us beginning services during the cancellation period, we will deduct reasonable costs to cover the services we performed. For full details, please see our terms and conditions. This is separate from our (actually more generous) 30-day no-questions-asked money-back guarantee.
  4. You can end the contract at any time as explained on our service. This does not give rise to a refund unless “cooling off” rights apply.
  5. You may be entitled to use an EU online dispute resolution service to assist with any contractual dispute you may have with us. This service can be found here.

html:
Message type: [WNC-376106]
Search Console

Improve the search presence of https://anhphamduy.pythonanywhere.com/

To: Webmaster of https://anhphamduy.pythonanywhere.com/

Google systems show that you recently verified your site in Search Console (or created a site with Blogger or Google Sites which does this automatically). We have some tips to help you get the most of this free service and maximize your site performance on Google Search.

Set up your Search Console account now:

1

Add all your website versions

Make sure you add separate Search Console properties for all URL variations that your site supports, including https, http, www, and non-www.

Add a site
2

Share access with co-workers

If you want other people to access your error reports and search analytics in Search Console, add them with the appropriate access levels.

Manage site users
3

Submit a sitemap file

This helps Google better understand how to crawl your site.

Submit a sitemap
4

Learn how to work with Search Console

If you read only one document, this is it.
Using Search Console

Not sure how to set this up? Use our help resources.

• Learn more details about site verification and how to set permissions for other users.
• Get help in setting a preferred domain or setting a geographic target.
• Learn what a sitemap is and how to manage it.
• Ask questions in our forum for more help - mention message type [WNC-376106].
Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway Mountain View, CA 94043 | You've received this service announcement email because your site is listed in Google Search Console | Unsubscribe from this type of message
